title: Lengthy Process for Business Licensing
description: In 2017, it took an average of 176 days to obtain an operating license in Uruguay, one of the longest durations globally.

title: Minimal Impact of Health Costs on Poverty
description: As of 2016, only 0.01% of Uruguay's population was pushed below the $2.15 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenditures, indicating strong financial protection.

title: Negligible External Health Expenditure
description: In 2021, external health expenditure accounted for just 0.00015186% of Uruguay's current health expenditure, showcasing a self-reliant health system.

title: Low External Health Expenditure Per Capita
description: Uruguay's external health expenditure per capita was only $0.0024 in 2021, reflecting minimal reliance on foreign health funding.

title: Minimal External Health Expenditure in PPP Terms
description: In 2021, Uruguay's external health expenditure per capita in PPP terms was a mere $0.0035, underscoring the country's economic independence in health financing.
